intro: Chloranthus nervosus var. khasianus, commonly known as the Khasi chloranthus, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves with prominent venation. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and limited distribution.
